Sentencas: This study focuses on the development and optimization of nanostructured anode electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) by infiltration method.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Ni (nickel) catalyst in the form of a nickel nitrate solution is infiltrated into porous YSZ (yttria stabilized zirconia) backbone fabricated by tape casting.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Numerous electrolyte-supported cells are fabricated to investigate the effects of several significant infiltration fabrication parameters such as catalyst loading and infiltration sintering temperature.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Conventional cell with screen printed Ni-YSZ anode is also fabricated for comparison.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical performances and microstructural properties of the cells are examined and evaluated.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The best peak performance of 0.398 W/cm2 at 800 degrees C is obtained from the cell, which is infiltrated 9 times with 2 M solution followed by firing at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The conventional cell, on the hand, exhibits only 0.174 W/cm2 under the same testing conditions in spite of the relatively higher Ni catalyst content in the anode.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the optimized cell produces 0.169 W/cm2 maximum power density at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The overall results reveal that nickel catalyst infiltration is a very effective method to improve the cell performance by providing increased number of electrochemical reaction zones within the anode electrode due to nanostructured nickel catalyst formed around the main YSZ phase.
Titulo: Optimizing infiltration parameters of nanostructured anode electrode in solid oxide fuel cells
